intro: Vantanea macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited vantanea, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruits are large, woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. Vantanea macrocarpa is often found in humid, tropical environments where it thrives in partial shade.
